description:
We had a delicious meal a couple of nights ago. Modern take on traditional Tunisian dishes. We had great conversations with the owner about food -- and history. 

We ordered snapper with turmeric cream sauce and big fat Spanish capers, garnished with mandolined curls of celery root. So pretty and so delicious. Perfectly cooked with crispy edges. 

Also beef short ribs with mashed potatoes and more celery root garnish. Succulent! Try the Tunisian baklava too. Individual servings, different types of nuts, and not nearly as sweet 

I would eat here regularly if I lived here. Give it a try, you'll be glad you did!
author: Betty M.

description:
Service was good, food wasn't great.

Everything was pre-heated and nothing was really prepared that dat
author: Daniel H.

description:
Nice looking little bar/bistro but I just had an awful experience and one that was totally avoidable. I was having wine with a friend and engrossed in deep conversation when we heard the clamor of dishes midway through our conversation. It was loud enough that our conversation stopped and we looked at the bar. I guess they were cleaning up some dishes - totally understandable - so we went on, talking.

The unfortunate and puzzling thing is that this noise/clamor did not stop for the next 20-30 minutes we were there. It was as if whoever was cleaning and arranging the dishes in plain view behind the bar was in a bad or angry mood and purposely clanging the dishes together while putting them away. Once or twice the guys behind the bar even caught us looking their way - it should have been evident that we were being disturbed - but they kept on with their loud chores. This was one of the more bizarre scenes I've been around. We eventually left to find another place to talk.
author: Mohammed M.

description: I'm in love with this little, intimate, Tunisian restaurant! Don't be intimidated by not knowing what Tunisian food is!! Think the most delicious, moist cous cous you've ever tasted, with so much flavor!! And the chicken...unique spices...not overpowering or too spicy. I ordered the deviled eggs as an app. The best part was how the owner told me how to eat them: cut them in half first!! I was about to eat them whole first. They are slightly spicy...but well worth it & the BEST deviled eggs I've ever tasted. Go out of your comfort zone & try this place!! A little bit of the Mediterranean/Northern Africa in San Francisco. So happy I came here on my vacation!!
author: Shawn W.

description: Fantastic food! The Tunisian influence is a refreshing change. Small and intimate, great ambiance, top notch service. Both breakfast and dinner are good times to come in and relax with bite to eat, something to sip on and great conversation with a very knowledgeable chef.
author: Jeramiah W.

description: Without a doubt one of the best dinners I've enjoyed in awhile!  We Started with glasses of smooth and tasty red wine then moved to the very best deviled eggs topped with spicy shrimp I've ever enjoyed!  Then it was on to my fish with mushrooms and swirled greens and a light sauce that was exceptional. My partner had the lamb shank and vegetables. He said it was outstanding. We didn't stay for dessert because we had to get to the San Francisco  Playhouse production of "Born Yesterday" but I assure you this tiny gem on Geary street is a place we will return to in the near future!!  Very good!!!
author: Willliam O.

description:
I like small plates dinners out. And I most often eat dinners on the run before a show. So when I decided to take a chance on La Marsa across the street from ACT, I wasn't READY for the beautiful Tunisian palette of flavors I met. Tunisian deviled eggs--must try. The lamb riblets insanely, indescribably rich and delicious. Those two small plates are a fine dinner with wine! 

It's one of those places you hate to crow about on Yelp cause the next time you try to get in, they're booked! But I send this review out to the 'verse--let La Marsa take care of you. Honey, they WILL!!!
author: Fe B.

description:
What a great place! We stopped by here to get a cup of coffee by chance while visiting SF, and people working here are very friendly. The owner was working when we were here and he was very kind and funny. I don't exactly remember but daaaaamn he speaks 4 languages! I only speak two and a little bit italian so I was shocked Lol Hahaha Anyway, he made everything like wall decorations, tables, etc! My husband and I were able to see that this man is serious and very passionate about his business. 

We got affocato, crème brûlée,.....i forgot what kind of tea I got Lol anyway they were so good. It was my husband's first time trying affocato and he liked it. Not too sweet but sweet enough to take away some of bitterness from coffee, you know what I mean....o_O) and there was crispy almond slice inside, which added a little bit of fun to the affocato! Crème brûlée was great with my tea. 

we wanted to try their breakfast menu but we couldn't make it. We will come back when we visit SF next time for sure!
author: Kim P.

description:
Absolutely awful. No air conditioning so it was humid and hot. The space is very small -- maybe 6 tables. Servers are tentative and unsure, like they have no idea what they're doing. The open kitchen is a mess. I saw the chef looking at the menu to check which ingredients was in what dish!?!  

I ordered the eggs florentine and my husband ordered the crab Benedict. It took about 30 minutes for our food to come out and it looked like the most unappetizing plate of food I had ever seen.  The spinach on the eggs florentine was supposed to be "wilted" according to the menu but it was completely uncooked and covered in neon yellow sauce. My husband's crab had like a weird brown color like it was ... old. 

For $40 this was completely unacceptable. 
Do not come here.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Rafik has proudly created (literally he created the art work, the atmosphere and an outstanding menu) a place that is family friendly, very warm and welcoming. The twist on his homeland culinary cuisine was cooked to perfection and his one man show (service) was proof that he is living his American Dream! Thanks Rafik for making our family gathering so very special!
We will "ANCHOR" here again next time we come up to the Bay Area.
author: Mary M.

description:
We walked into a simple, beautiful environment, with a warm welcome. Being from Tunisia, I had been brought 
A taste of it. Authentic music, elegant ambiance and amazing food.  
To top it off it's in the heart of San Francisco. 
So after or before a great day or evening (Bon Appétit).
author: Anis B.

description: One of the more unique dining experiences I've had in a long time- modern Tunisian cuisine that all can enjoy at reasonable prices as well! Take it from someone who dines out a lot, you won't find a restaurant with a atmosphere like this anywhere else in the country. I loved the Tunisian music playing throughout our meal. This place is absolutely worth visiting. You must try the deviled eggs! Great service - the owner was very welcoming, friendly and went above and beyond, like any Tunisian would! I really enjoyed the atmosphere. This is a great place to come for a intimate dining experience and you won't be disappointed! Thanks again Rafik!
author: Sonia A.

description:
I thought this place was A-OK. The atmosphere is pretty welcoming but it's a small space. We stopped by for breakfast and luckily there was no wait. You go up to the counter, order and wait for your food to come out. 

Beef and lamb sausage breakfast sandwich was good and it came with a small well dressed salad. The croissant was the best part of the sandwich, incredibly buttery, flaky and light. The sausage was OK for me, maybe to cover up that typical lamb taste/smell but it was cardamom-strong. 

It's A-OK, but unfortunately, forgettable in the city of SF.
author: Amy K.

description: Cute ambiance (though small) and super friendly staff and owner. Unfortunately, the crepes were just so-so. Tons of ingredients and passion in the dish, but felt it was not as crispy or delicious as that of at other places like Chez Maman, where it is crispy, savory or sweet depending on your preference and absolutely delicious.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
Worst breakfast and service ever.
Yucky. Don't waste your time and money. 
The workers don't even know their menu.
author: Gleice B.

description:
This review is for the person who was taking orders this morning. I believe his name is Rafik and who humiliated us and treated so poorly.

The place was very busy, so its understandable that he was rushed to take our order. However, when we asked for his help to order he refused to help and was very aggressive and shoved the menu in my face. Mind you, we had been there the previous day and decided that we wanted to come back and give them more of our valuable business. Why I wanted his help if we had been here the previous day you may ask, very simple I wanted to try something different and was hoping to enjoy a nice meal here.

Instead, he refused to give me any insight into their menu and rushed me to order the same thing I had ordered the previous day. A few minutes later we sat down at our table which was very dirty. By then he was no longer busy so I signaled him to make our table more presentable and wipe it down. As I did this I whispered to my friend that the host did not help me with the menu and pretty much forced me to order something I had already tried. 

He overhead what I said and raised his voice and said he would give us our money back and wanted us out of the restaurant. My jaw dropped, I was never disrespectful and was only stating the truth. 

I'm convinced that this was a serious case of discrimination and racism!

I will never return here, and will make sure to let others know about my experience here.
author: Soguis H.

description:
My wife and I came here after the sink in the bathroom did not work at a ramen place. So my first reaction to this place was that the restroom was clean and functional.

I ordered the snapper and my wife ordered the short rib and some wine. I really like the flavors and presentation of my dish, and the small taste of my wife's dish was also very good. I regret not ordering wine because my wife's Tuscan wine was fantastic.

When we discovered that the chef is also the bar tender and also the server, we were in disbelief. He did an excellent job; we didn't have wait long for anything and he was very attentive.

This place is so good that I will be returning.
author: Michael F.

description:
My girlfriend and I were looking for pre-show dinner close to the Curran Theater. La Marsa was a fantastic choice + right across the street. We were greeted warmly by the waiter (I think owner). He was attentive and very friendly. We ordered the deviled eggs which were delicious and very unique. I highly recommend trying them out. I had the lamb shank and my friend had the red snapper and we agreed both were fantastic. I will definitely eat here again before our next show! 
The four star is mainly for the back of the restaurant and not related to service or the food. It would be better to not have stored boxes by the restroom and to maybe cover that up with something to hide the clutter so that area so it looks cleaner. The restroom, while clean, could use some tiding as there were some random pieces of furniture.
author: Erika G.

description: My neighbor treated me to lunch, of course at La Marsa, and I had the egghead eggs Benedict, perfection as always, paired with a vanilla latte! Another splendid experience here!
author: Reynaldo A.

description:
We had dinner at La Marsa. It was 8 of us and we occupied almost half of the Resturant. We were looking for Tunisian Resturant and not sure what to expect. Everything was so much better than our expectation. The owner ( Rafik) was genuine, friendly and passionate  about his Resturant. We tried all the appetizers and all the main dishes. Everything was fantastic. The tuna over baguette and the sea food stew were my favorites. Although all the appetizers were great. The chicken and the red snapper were  the table's favorite. But we loved it all. 
Rafik,went our of his way and brought dessert and Tunisian tea to the table as extra treat just . La Marsa will be one of our favorite. 

Erhabkj
author: Nazzi N.

description: Such a cute and intimate place. Great ambiance and the owner is extremely friendly with great hospitality. The food is great. We tried the la Marsa crepe with an egg on top and hands down one of the best savory crepes I've ever had. The beef/lamb sausage adds a unique Mediterranean flavor to the dish. The banana Nutella crepe was very nice for a touch of sweetness without being overwhelmingly sweet. The shashouka is definitely on the lighter and healthier side but great for people who love veggies!
author: Jaklin G.

description: What an awesome find! Was walking down Geary looking for a wine bar and stumbled into this place. Was pleasantly surprised to find they had a great looking menu with great prices (for Union Square)
author: Drew R.

description: We ordered a bottle of Malbec, cheese plate, short rib, lamb shank, adffogato. Perfect meal! Lamb fell off the bone. Short rib was so tender, only used a fork. Vegs mix added perfect flavors and textures - capers, potato's, squash. So good! Super friendly staff!
author: M M.

description:
Just returned from a wonderful dinner at La Marsa after a matinee at A.C.T. right across the street. La Marsa specializes in Tunisian food, and was recommended on the A.C.T. website with good reviews, so we decided to try it. Very small and cozy with only about 8-10 tables, welcoming and clean. The owner/server was very personable and gracious - let us try the wine before we purchased - and helped us decide what to order. Started with the cheese plate (served on a beautiful olive wood board) - a nice display of 3 delicious cheeses, toast, dates, honey, almonds and fresh raspberries and the spicy seafood stew. The stew was tasty, but wish it came with some additional bread to soak up the flavorful sauce. 

Between 3 of us, we tried the Beef Short Ribs with truffled mashed potatoes, Lamb Shank w/ vegetables, and the fresh Red Snapper with mushrooms, celery root and lemon cream sauce. ALL delicious, perfectly prepared and beautifully presented. We were all pleasantly surprised - prices also very reasonable for San Francisco. Will definitely go back, and would highly recommend - before theatre, after theatre, or just because. P.S. per A.C.T. website, they offer a 15% discount with your ticket stub, but we wanted to offer support to this small business and did not ask.
author: Mama D.

description: Interesting ideas of using wheat flour to make breakfast. The food tastes okay but I still feel hungry after having one plate.
author: Minzhi Y.

description: Amazing food. So fresh and a beautiful presentation. Awesome customer service. We will definitely be coming back!
author: Carly J.

description: Favorite restaurant in the city. They scored 100 from the health department indeed the cleanest restaurant. In the area. Must try a very awesome wine list and the owner is very passionate about his business.
author: Nizar A.

description: OMG.  We had a great meal at La Marsa.  The deviled eggs were perhaps the best taste combination ever and the chicken and ribs dinner was full of flavor.  The baklava completed an amazing meal.  To top it off, the owner was amazing in his description of what we were eating and how it tied in with Tunisian cuisine.  We will travel again from Oregon for another meal at La Marsa.
author: Susan M.

description:
Stumbled here on our first night in SF. The 5-star ratings don't lie at all. Classy spot yet not pretentious. The chef is the nicest and makes such beautiful creations right in front of you (makes it look easy haha but it's not!) 

We had the cod and short rib (with deviled eggs to start.) See the photos .
author: Ms. R.

description: Cute, quaint, lighter portions and great flavors. I had the criminal benny, and she had the florintine. Both on point. Cappacinnos were really hot but made well burned her tongue pretty bad. Crepes looked good. Fair prices. Cooks were working hard. Main host was busy seating and bussing. Super polite...but the Ice water smelled bad like old dirty dishwater. That was a real letdown..4 stars if not for that water..
author: Dan W.

description:
Found this gem on yelp and decided to give it a try.

At night, this cafe turns into a trendy upscale restaurant. We were greeted with a happy and helpful owner/chef that helped us navigate the menu. It was clear that his favorite was the short rib and he had been working on it since this morning, we were sold and wow! It was some of the best short rib I've had in a long time. The marinade was just right, the texture was smooth and it came apart easily with your fork. I highly recommend giving this place a try. 

Will be back to try more menu items!!!
author: Y L.

description: This is truly special. We had the braised Moroccan chicken and the La Marsa crepe. Never have had anything like it. We also had espresso. Very nice staff, loved the cooks and the atmosphere. We were able to sit down and be served which is nice. Highly recommend this place.
author: Allison S.

description:
I was walking with my girlfriend and we decided to give this place a try and we were mind blown!! 
We tried several dishes from the eggs with shrimp appetizer (highly recommended) all the way to pretty much every entree in the menu. The lamb was incredible so we decided to give the fish a try and we just wanted more... so we ordered the chicken and the beef and we still have not decided which one was better!
Definitely going to my preferred restaurant list in the city!!
author: Michael A.

description: Light, simple, elegant--and delicious! Music is on point, slight breeze through the airy space, homey feel with wood tables and leather seating. Great place for a quiet breakfast! (Came on a Tuesday, might be different on weekends)
author: Catherine W.

description: This is a great little restaurant. The owner/chef/waiter is charming and his food is delicious! Everything we ate was 5 star. Deviled eggs were the most delicious eggs I had ever had--and nothing like your grandmother makes for picnics! My red snapper was delicious.. Generally I like food to taste like the food--but this snapper was not "fishy". Off the charts great! Everyone liked their meal. Support this little place with great food and a big heart!
author: Mary T.

description:
I was drawn here by the photos and the near-perfect 5 star rating, however, I think I was bamboozled. 

I wasn't sure I was on the right block because everything around it is pretty run down, but there was a somewhat better looking storefront albeit very small that suddenly appears without advanced line of sight. Maybe 5 or 6 small tables inside. 1 dude running everything from what I could tell, from taking orders to cooking to serving table side and then taking payment. Very nice gentleman. 

The dish I ordered was a bit perplexing, being that it was called "The Meathead" but offered no meat save a couple ounces of salmon. Visually, it looked pretty amazing and I was with high hopes. A buckwheat crepe with salmon, caramelized onions, sunny side egg and a small salad like you would get with a quiche. The buckwheat crepe was with a horrible burnt flavor and inedible. I left 90% of that on the plate. The salmon was cooked well, as the egg, but the caramelized onions did not go with the dish at all. 

I left with disappointment. Perhaps I ordered the wrong thing. The sweet crepes looked amazing and the fellow patrons seemed to enjoy.  

Lots of 5 star reviews though...cough.
author: Billy G.

description:
Very cute little place in San Francisco..
I stayed at the Clift hotel and strolling around to check the brunch place. I found this little gems with Interesting menu. I try the shakshuka and it's really good. I love this place and definitely come back.
author: Sarah A.

description:
What a hidden treasure near Union Square! I will definitely be going back! Rafik (the owner) could not have been more hospitable. We pretty much ordered one of everything on the menu and loved it all! It's a small menu that has been perfected. What Rafik said is that he took traditional Tunisian cuisine and deconstructed it for presentation.  

My favorite was probably the tuna appetizer. Oh but the seafood stew was amazing too! Everything was prepared with such thoughtful attention to detail. 

Rafik knew so much about Tunisian cuisine, the history of the region and offered a wonderful cultural experience for us. Warm, cozy atmosphere with a vibe of an upscale neighborhood restaurant. 

Oh... the topper was that Rafik told us dessert was not really their specialty but 10 min later he presented us with some of the creme brûlée we've ever had. Ask him for the black tea with mint and almonds. Not on the menu but delicious end to a wonderful meal!
author: K N.

description: Stopped here for breakfast on Saturday morning and had the most delicious freshly cooked vegetarian omelette with spinach, squash, mushrooms etc. Service was great and the team really friendly. We sat at the bar overlooking the serving / cooking area as there were no tables free when we got there and it was great to see how well the team worked together to get the food out smoothly and quickly. Really glad we found this place.
author: Elaine S.

description:
Short ribs were tender! 

The snapper is a new and amazing taste to me....so good! The chef is the server and he is very attentive.

Definitely coming back.
author: Roberto G.

description: We stopped into La Marsa for breakfast on a Tuesday morning. The joint is small - just a few tables inside, seating for maybe 10. My boyfriend ordered the vegetarian omelette with roasted potatoes, and I got the egghead Benedict (eggs Benedict with smoked salmon). Both meals were DELICIOUS. It took a few minutes for our order to come out and everything was piping hot. My eggs were seriously perfection. I'd recommend La Marsa and would definitely come here again!
author: Samantha O.

description: Small little wine/breakfast/crepe place. Seating for about 25 people total with counter service. The crepes are all gluten free! We got the Nutella banana which was delicious!
author: Danielle M.

description: Seriously the best food I've had in SF. Small place, super clean, cozy and absolutely fabulous! You can order anything on the menu and be extremely happy! It's served fresh and hot. I will visit this place time and time again when I am here. Wonderful!
author: Holly C.

description:
Quaint and cute little cafe in the heart of Union Square. Service was outstanding. The staff was friendly and attentive. The food....delicious! Simple, flavorful and the portions were just right. We ate the crab Benedict, vegetarian omelette and a complimentary Nutella crepe gifted by the staff. Definitely recommend!

Only con, no air conditioning when we visited.  It was nice and cool outside and the restaurant door was open but we sat at the breakfast bar, adjacent to the grill/kitchen, and it was quite warm.  Perfect for our group but may be warm for others.  In that case, I suggest a table by the door.

You won't be disappointed here.  The food is amazing and the location is just perfect.  Enjoy!!!
author: Paige B.

description:
My husband and I happened upon this place. The menu looked good and there were tables so we went inside. It was AMAZING! There was one guy who was the chef, the bartender, and the waiter. Kudos to him for doing all the work. I am really impressed with the quality of service and the quality of food all performed by one individual. 

I ordered the braised beef with truffle mashed potatoes with a side of Tuscan wine and it melted in my mouth, it was so delicious. The truffle mashed potatoes are really something to try. My husband and I will be coming again.
author: Japna S.

description: I had dinner here and loved it. I had a custom made vegetarian dish with couscous the taste of the couscous was out of this world; it was very flavorful. I loved the seasoning and spices of the foods. The cheese platter was also great tasting as an appetizer. My family had the lamb shank which they loved and the short rib which they said was very flavorful and tender.
author: Ripsime D.

description:
Went here on a whim for breakfast with my boyfriend. When we got there, there were 2 girls in front of us chatting/ordering with the owner. He saw us come in but proceeded to flirt with the girls, which eventually led to an even longer wait and line as more people showed up. He definitely noticed, but didn't seem to care. 

When we got up to the register, his smile disappeared despite our friendliness, and he was incredibly rude (not even a hello or good morning!) There was absolutely no reason for his attitude and short answers. We contemplated leaving but decided to stay, since we had somewhere else to be shortly after. 

We finally got our food (eggs Benedict, a basic crepe, and a coffee) after having to ask him when it would be ready because it was taking so long. Food wasn't great, and definitely not worth the wait and unfriendly service.
author: Kristine M.

description:
Great new spot to grab breakfast or lunch and coffee. AND it's a wine bar at night! What a great concept! 
Great pre-show bite before heading over to the Curran or A.C.T. !
author: Griffen H.

description: Excellent food with incredible flavors and spices! The owner gave us such great service. We had the deviled eggs, seafood stew, roasted chicken, and short ribs. Everything was fantastic! We will be back!
author: Gail F.

description: Had a great crepe. This place is tiny. Service was not the greatest but after some nagging, we got what we ordered, and the food was good enough that I'd definitely go back.
author: Sam Z.

description:
This is a must for breakfast while in San Fran! We walked right by a very busy breakfast restaurant right to this little gem. The restaurant itself is tiny but the food has big flavor. Awesome service by friendly staff.
Don't miss this.
author: Jane M.

description: What a delightful spot in the neighborhood.  Two impeccable family members treated us to a delicious dinner.  The deviled eggs & spicy Tunisian stew to start,both had a perfect spices.  And an awesome red snapper in lemon sauce and perfectly charred short ribs. As someone who lives close by I expect to be a very happy and repeat customer.
author: J T.

description: Rude waiter/host. Didn't greet us when we got there and asked when we made the reservation. Finally found it. Then sat us in the worst table (hot from kitchen). When asked if we could move he said no because a group of 11 was coming. Ok. Then at six minutes after our reservation he said if we didn't order he couldn't wait on us with no apology. I've never been treated so rudely and this literally is the first time I've left a restaurant. Avoid. They apparently only care about the groups.
author: stephanie c.

description: Small but great and unassuming place for breakfast & brunch.  With an out-of-America twist & taste to its traditional breakfast dishes, La Marsa (the name of a suburb to Tunis, The capital of Tunisia) is with a detour and a meal.
author: Jacob K.

description: I'm not sure why this place has a good rating, maybe my experience was a bad one. I went there for breakfast, ordered small coffee and veggie omlet with roasted potatoes. Coffee looked like dirt water so I didn't even drank it. Veggie omlet was pretty much raw egg in the middle and uncooked vegetables. Potatoes were microwave cooked potatoes tossed in oil, salt and pepper. Very bad experience. I paid 20$ including tip and didn't eat had to go to another place to eat. Staff were so distracted as well chit chatting within themselves or long conversation with other customers, so service was slow
author: Mahnoush T.

description: My daughter wanted pancakes this last Saturday but non could be found in downtown SF so went to La Marsa for crapes.  Got to say best crapes I've had in a long time.  Service was also not that bad.  Only con, was the location was small.
author: Gary P.

description:
Really disappointed in the breakfast at this place! I came here last time I was in town for a conference and remember enjoying my meal: a sandwich and a sweet crepe. But this time, I ordered eggshead benedict and I deeply regret it! I was served the worst possible poached eggs I've ever had. The eggs were not only severely undercooked but they were also dripping in what I presume was vinegar and water. I could barely eat my meal, because of the how bad it smelled (between the raw eggs and the vinegar). The english muffins were soggy because of how liquidy the "poached eggs" were.

If you go here, stick with the crepes and sandwiches!!
author: Maryam A.

description: Amaze-balls! Friendly and very hospitable service. Food was made fresh and was delicious. I had the "Criminal" (mutton Benedict). It is a very small spot but the 4.5 Stars was earned.
author: Luis R.

description:
A fabulous brand-new Tunisian/Mediterranean find right across the street from ACT (and the Geary theater). . . .if you like wonderful hole-in-the-wall European style restaurants this is the place. The chef, a one-man band, prepares the food and serves it. La Marsa is small and intimate, with simple tables adding to the charm. I had the braised lamb and it was delicious.

A review dated 6/16 is as foolish as it is inaccurate. . . criticizing a small restaurant for lack of air-conditioning - in foggy San Francisco of all places?  And none of the other comments remotely resembled the place we dined.  Ignore it and try La Marsa
author: Matthew N.

description: Love this little restaurant! The food is really tasty! I went there for breakfast and really recommend the savory crepe La Marsa with lamb Merguez. Also the Shakshuka. If you like spicy ask for the hot salsa sauce.  Glad to find this little gem in the city.
author: Tia A.

description: We loved, loved, loved this little cafe. Nothing was pretentious and they were very sincere, local café and the vegetable with eggs dish that we had was literally perfectly seasoned and an amazing experience. it made our trip unexpectedly wonderful.
author: Carrie K.

description: Simply beautiful and amazing Tunisian cuisine. Service is impeccable. Great ambiance, a perfect evening to dine. My mentee from UAE & I happened across this restaurant. And happy we did.
author: Johnson H.

description: There is a 24 hour Diner across the street from La Marsa. We walked by it but the line was out the door so the wife and I decided to try this small little bistro. At the time only a cook and a waiter were working so we thought it was going to be a little slow. On the contrary, not only were they quick but also extremely nice, attentive and overall pleasant. The food was also very tasty, and well presented. The cook had a french accent so I can only assume this is an authentic french bistro.
author: Rafael M.

description: Really disappointed in this place given the rating. The crepes are with buckwheat flour, which tends to be very gritty. They do not do anything to mitigate this and therefore the crepes taste horrible. I got the lox savory crepes and they just heated up cold smoked salmon, which was therefore kind of sour. Yuck. I didn't even finish it. Would not recommend; not going back.
author: Aggie S.

description: Great healthy breakfast.  Had veggie omelet and robust cup of coffee.  Small spring mix salad and roasted potato's hit the spot.
author: Robert S.

description: The food is really awesome, Benedict's  different,  crepes are simple and delicious, good service, la Marsa good place to eat.
author: Wonka M.

description: Pretty good breakfast. We both got the ratatouille crepe, his came out crispy and mine soft, but we each preferred it the other way, so we switched and it was great. I was a little caught off guard by the host (guy serving us the food) when he briskly told us to wait outside (for a really long time), before being seated, I definitely didn't like that. Was about to leave, but was convinced to stay. Food was surprisingly delicious, but dunno if I'll return again. If he couldn't be polite, then he should've just put a paper for people to put their names on a list and have a sign for people to wait outside. Some of us come from really far and chose to try this place, and it's annoying to be so bluntly told to wait outside in the cold so early in the morning like that. Lucky for him the food was good so I'll give them the stars.
author: See B.

description:
I was in town for a conference and wanted a place where I could grab a memorable breakfast before heading back home.  I ordered the Big Head Benedict, which took a regular eggs Benedict and replaced the Canadian bacon with salmon, then added capers and fried onions.  Absolutely delicious. 
The place is very small, so come during non-prime hours (I came at 9am on a Friday morning).  Still found a place to sit and watch pedestrians strolling by.  
If I come back to SF I'll definitely be coming here again!
author: Tim D.

description: Very solid breakfast. I went for the breakfast sandwich with lamb sausage; very tender and full of fennel! I got a latte, no so great. I didn't get a crepe but they looked huge and filling! I'd say this place is solid, nice design, not so great coffee.
author: Casie M.

description: Love this spot and the incredible Mediterranean/Tunisian food. Far better than anything else near Union Square. Try the deviled eggs and the lamb for sure.
author: David P.

description: Amazing Tunisian Foods and perfect services, love it , all foods was great with good meats quality and spices
author: Ons M.

description: I had lunch here yesterday with my husband and it was phenomenal. I got eggs benedict Florentine and was very happy. My husband got the pesto crepe and it was amazing. The guys cooking were super friendly. I highly recommend stopping in!
author: Suzanne D.

description: Wonderful  Tunisian dinner spot right across from the Curran Theater.  Cozy friendly and the Red Snapper , greens that topped it and sauce  was outstanding.  Try the baclava for dessert.  Will return
author: Connie F.

description: It was a very good breakfast. My wife and I both had three egg omelettes very well done. She had meat and I had the salmon omelette. The ingredients paired very well and the portion sizes were perfect.
author: Donathan S.

description: Great small little bistro style restaurant. I love the Turkish/Mediterranean flare with the mix of the traditional American staples. The interior is quite small but it's quaint and if you find a little table by the window...all the better! I highly recommend the shakshuka which was different than what I was used to but great nonetheless. My husband had a breakfast sandwich AND the nutella crepe. All in all it was a great experience (and any restaurant that serves "Illy" coffee gets a head start in my book)
author: Jay G.

description: I love the atmosphere here, the food was great and it was close to my hotel. Win, win, win. I usually came for breakfast and when we went somewhere else, I wished I were here instead.
author: Richard W.

description: Don't let the exterior fool you. The food here is tremendous! And the owner is a gracious young man who will make you feel at home.
author: Tom E.

description:
Little tiny place in downtown Frisco.
The service is pretty good, but they still need to work in their menu and dishes.
Medium quality, and they served a very original crepes dough.
Wishing them the best to succeed in a City that offers the best culinary experiences ever.
author: Lilly R.

description: We had an awesome lunch here. Great service and Rafik the owner was so attentive! Went for a business lunch and rafik made space for us immediately. There were delicious vegetarian options too.
author: Ivy R.

description:
Such a warm invitation into a very relaxing, suductive atmosphere. The music takes you someplace far from Union Square to another part of the world where things, the food, and people are rich with authenticity. 

I had the cumin crusted cod, and it was so delightful I nearly licked the plate clean. The two reds I had were delicious as well.  

A wonderful experience, I will be back time and time again.
author: Melissa C.

description: Such good food, great ingredients, rich flavor and nice presentation. Lunch was so good I'm going back for dinner.
author: Brian H.

description:
I have eaten at La Marsa four times in the past three months. This will be a long review as I want to share about each experience, but from the start I want to encourage you to try this place. I have traveled in many countries, eaten in many restaurants, and have had excellent food, but La Marsa has touched me for two reasons-unique, high quality food with fresh ingredients and connection. The first time I ate here was when I was with my husband and another couple. We were staying near Union Square in December 2017. We asked the staff at the hotel for a breakfast recommendation, they suggested La Marsa. When we saw that they served buckwheat crepes with lamb sausage we could hardly believe our eyes. I am a baker and my husband is a chef; we don't eat out often because we make such great food at home, but this was something we knew we would not be making at home! 

My husband and I shared the La Marsa crepe, the flavors were subtle, but so delicious-the cumin balanced nicely with the spiciness of the sofrito sauce. The crepe was accompanied by a lightly dressed small salad of fresh greens. There was plenty for the two of us to share, though I would have been happy to eat it all myself! My Americano was excellent, bold without being bitter. 

Our companions got the Shakshouka and an omelette, both were thoroughly enjoyed. I tasted the Shakshouka, the eggs were baked to perfection and the ratatouille was flavorful, the combination with the chickpeas and sofrito sauce was excellent. In my book, many restaurants ruin omelettes-either by overcooking or adding too much cheese. Our friend said her omelette was delicious and again very flavorful. 

I knew I would be returning to Union Square for a week in San Francisco with my sister in February. I couldn't wait to introduce her to La Marsa. We came for breakfast on Wednesday.  We shared the La Marsa savory lamb crepe and then followed up with a sweet crepe with bananas and Nutella. The savory crepe was a treat once again, even better than I remembered. The sweet crepe which is also gluten free, but made from a gluten free flour blend instead of the buckwheat, was lighter and every bit delicious in its own way. The greater treat that morning was meeting Rafik the owner. We talked about food, culture, dreams, community, and life. He is very committed to giving you not just excellent fare, but a wonderful experience as well. This is also when we found out that La Marsa was open for dinner. 

We returned on Thursday for dinner, the restaurant was transformed. What was an inviting cafe, was now a warm, intimate space. The mood was set with candlelight and low overhead lighting. We started with the Tunisian deviled eggs with shrimp, then shared the Cumin crusted Red Snapper and Braised Short Ribs. Everything was perfection! The flavor combinations, the tenderness of the meat, the crunchy outside of the fish with the tangy lemon cream sauce. I had never tasted anything like it. Despite Rafik acting as waiter and chef, he still took time out to make sure we were enjoying our meal and shared some more of his passion about his food and his place. Of course we had to get dessert-the Affogato and the creme brûlée were both delicious. I am not a big fan of creme brûlée, but Rafik's made me a believer. 

We were leaving on Friday and decided we needed one more opportunity to enjoy La Marsa, so we went back for breakfast. Though, we know everything would be worthy of trying, we didn't want to miss out on our savory lamb crepe and decided we needed a repeat of the sweet crepe with Nutella and banana too. Another excellent Americano rounded out my breakfast and we said goodbye to our newfound friend, looking forward to our next time in San Francisco and especially our next time at La Marsa.
author: Bliss B.

description: I love shakshouka and it was on point here!  Ask for the hot sauce paste for an added kick.  Great service and nice employees make it a comfortable and cozy place to enjoy a meal and some drinks.
author: Shak H.

description: Been driving past here for months. Tried it for the first time a couple weeks ago with a friend visiting San Francisco. The location is convenient if you're staying in the Union Square area or you work downtown. I think they make crepes during the day. At night they serve a few appetizers and a few main dishes. We tried a little of both - the cheese plate and the tuna appetizer were delicious and the right size for two people to share. If you're more hungry try the lamb! The host and everyone working here is very friendly and talkative. You'll feel welcome and it's easy to leave after two or three glasses of wine, even if you came in just for one. At night all the candles and hanging lanterns are romantic and cozy - a nice touch.
author: Sonya S.

description: Wow, what a find! We had a big group for dinner and were able to try almost everything on the menu. Everything was delicious - a perfect marriage of flavors, textures, and presentation. The Lamb Shank was fall-off-the-bone tender and rich with flavor. The Red Snapper was perfectly cooked. Rafik was a wonderful host - it felt like we were at an intimate dinner party. We've been going out to dinner together for several years now, trying food from around the world and we all agree that this place was our favorite.
author: Justine W.

description: Absolutely one of the best dining experiences I've ever had! I hadn't even looked at any reviews, I kind of picked the place based on instinct and a glance at the menu and atmosphere. My friend and I had the Tunisian deviled eggs, and then the snapper and short rib entrees (along with whatever wine rec they gave us, which was also perfect and well-paired). I spent a long time living in NYC/that area, and before that, various places across the globe, and likewise have eaten at a wide array of memorable places. Somehow it took my experience at La Marsa (well, and a few other good recent tries) to FINALLY inspire me to start writing Yelp reviews, lol. I was just *that* charmed by this place -- in all respects, the highlight of which, of course, was the food; I feel like there's not much I could say to really do it justice, other than to fiercely recommend it!! The head chef (it's a really small staff here, I believe it's usually just him and then the owner/chef who do the cooking AND serving -- but no worries, service is quick and attentive) is lovely and truly passionate about this food and about the experience La Marsa offers. The food would bring me back regardless of how I felt about the rest of it, but, fortunately, the atmosphere and service were as unbeatable as the food. Can't wait to go again.
author: Rachel K.

description: YES.  It is that Good.  Wonderful Eggs Benedcit , which I rarely order, but this one is out of this world.  Excellent service, great food, great vibes.  Don't hesitate, eat and enjoy.  Wonderful people too.
author: Jason N.

description: This tiny restaurant is both very fast and very good. Tried both lunch and dinner, and while I enjoyed both I'll probably go back mainly for sweet crepe. Sweet crepes are all gluten free. I had forbidden fruit, which is caramelized apples with caramel & sea salt. For dinner there's only 1 vegetarian option, and it's on the expensive side, but still delicious ( not sure if it changes, but I had lightly sauteed greens + truffle mashed potatoes + couscous)
author: Emy M.

description: Delicate and tasty food! We order 2 of dinner menu in the noon. Best I have in SF this month.
author: Tianlu W.

description: We had a very tasty and healthy breakfast.  I ordered a vegetarian omelette; it was delicious and just right.  But, in case you have a huge appetite, beware that portions are not big, specially the "Sandwiches." The venue is very small too, therefore you might end up waiting outside after placing your order or simply ordering to-go.  We were fortunate to find a table right away.  It was a great last minute find on a Sunday morning in Dwntwn SF.
author: Pamela D.

description: Grilled Salad was exquisite! Taste is perfect, brings back the best memories of Tunisian food. A very well designed, cozy place to partake in a meticulously made meal.
author: Houssem I.

description: Stumbled on this place by accident, tiny and intimate, a romantic spot!  Lovely music, excellent service.  My dinner (short ribs) was wonderful.  I recommend you try it!
author: Jan G.

description:
What a wonderful and unexpected surprise. We were looking for somewhere to eat on our way to the Curran and every place was booked and crowded. La Marsa looked so warm and welcoming and the menu just right so we went in. Very soon all the tables were full also with people headed to the Curran. The owner took a deep breath, dove right in and got us all fed and out the door while still providing excellent service.

The three of us share the delightful deviled eggs appetizer. They must be tried to be understood. We then shared two entree's: the short ribs with mashed potatoes which were perfectly divine and the roasted half-chicken with couscous which was juicy and flavorful and filling.

I suspect this won't be a secret for long -- get there while you can still get a seat!
author: Sherri C.

description: The lamb shank and short rib are amazing! The owner/server is so kind, genuine and knowledge about the food and beverage selections. The wine selection includes really good wines and the food is great with pairings included. To finish the meal, the crime brûlée is an excellent choice. Enjoy this wonderful mean and excellent service!
author: Kaitlin W.

description:
What a surprise. It is a small little place and wasn't expecting much, Especially after seeing the line at the place down the street. 

Ordered the crab cake eggs Benedict and it was amazing, one of the best breakfasts I have had. I had the place to myself and it was wonderful. Coffee was great. Definitely will be back again.
author: Brent S.

description: Met the owner Rafik tonight and he's the sweetest genuine person ever. He made my friends and I comfortable and felt at home he was really friendly! Definitely going back again! Thank you Rafik! And I wish your business the best of luck!
author: Jan C.

description:
Excellent place! Ended up here on the recommendation of an usher at the Curran Theater across the street. I had marched in the Women's March in the rain all day and was looking for a place to warm up and rest while waiting for the show at the theater to let out. 

The proprietor, Rafik, was wonderful; he recommended a great wine that was not on my radar, and generously brought me all kinds of traditional Tunisian foods to taste. We ended up staying well past closing time listening to his stories, and how he ended up opening this little place. 

Highly recommended!
author: Jane D.

description:
Great service and excellent food.

We visited for dinner after a matinee across the street.  The owner waited on us personally and he was both helpful and friendly.

The food was great.  I had the roast chicken which was tender and succulent.  Creme Brule for desert was excellent.  Prices were reasonable.

It is very small  - but if you can get in, go there.
author: Andrew W.

description: Rafik has hostility issues.  I was with my two children and was expecting my niece and her friend to meet us there for breakfast.  We arrived first.  I walked in and saw that the place was rather small, and that seating could be tight. As I gazed toward an open table for four, Rafik, following my eyes, barked: "No seating until you order and pay."   Fair enough, I thought, as he doesn't have room for loiterers and campers.  So I grabbed a menu -- a single xeroxed sheet of white paper-- and headed outside to take a look while we waited for my niece.   I took a few steps away from the door only to see an agitated Rafik chase me down to declare that "Menus are for customers."   Astonished that he would abandon his cash register and other customers to confront me like that, I said "we were going to be customers, but not now," and I handed him his precious sheet of paper back.   Worst food I never tasted...
author: John A.

description: Awesome restaurant, tried dinner and breakfast, it feels like two different places. Awesome food, great friendly owner!
author: Emna G.

description: I must say that food at La Marsa is amazing! We had dinner with my friends and chef surprised us with delicious braised chops and roasted chicken. Meet was tender and juicy and chicken was full of flavor with rich mashed potatoes and cooked vegetables. He was a great host and provided good company and great wine. Don't miss out this new authentic restaurant on Geary.
author: Ana G.

description:
Over their heads. They used to be really good. 
Now mediocre food, terrible service. Just because there's a line of people waiting to be seated, they forget that they are in the service industry. Stuffing customers in the really hot corners by the kitchen, asking customers to take their own menus, without ever smiling, as if they are doing you a favor, while expecting to be paid a tip at the same time. Just down right rude with the "if you don't wanna eat here other people would". We as customers, who are paying to let you stay afloat, must not indulge this kind of behavior.
To owner: This was Monday Labor Day morning at 10:30am. You probably need to have a talk with whichever employee was manning the shop, because I've met you and you are warm and welcome.
author: Jenny J.

description: This place had one of the most delicious breakfast I can ever remember. We got the Lamarsa crepe with an egg.  It's too bad I live so far away however I will be back next time I visit San Francisco, which I hope will be soon. The meals are very reasonably priced. Get there early because the line starts growing at 10 AM on the weekend. Obviously there are others who know how good this place is.
author: Christine H.

description: What a beautiful restaurant to have a nice brunch! Staff was very friendly, the food was excellent, restaurant was very clean! I would recommend this restaurant and if ever back in that area we will return!
author: Melissa A.

description: Had lunch here, the Braised Moroccan Chicken Sandwich. Nice, crusty bread. The chicken was shredded and mixed with other ingredients, almost like a tuna sandwich. Good flavor. I'd get t again. Quick service. I'd recommend it.
author: J W.

description: La Marsa is an amazing new restaurant that exceeded 5 star  expectations for flavor, friendliness and flair. Rafik the owner, chef de cuisine and garçon expertly maneuvers the entire dining room and bar all the while graciously delighting patrons with his passion and the evolution of his vision. Definitely try the delicious lamb riblets, the wildly flavorful short rib and last but not least the espresso desert. 5 stars all the way. Thanks Rafik for a wonderful culinary and most welcoming dining experience. Cheers!
author: Gene E.

description:
We stayed near Union Square at a fancy hotel. My husband was there for work so his food was paid for; I didn't feel like spending $14 for hotel oatmeal.

La Marsa is small, and it was hot inside on a rare 90 degree day in SF. It was no worse than much more expensive restaurants where we ate nearby!

The young waiter was very quick and efficient. He was friendly and polite.

I ate alone at around 10 am on a weekday so only one other table was occupied at the time, but the other party was large (6-8 people?)

The crepes are gluten free and absolutely delicious. I had mine "natural"--just butter and powdered sugar. Really good!

The espresso was as good as many specialty shops, but reasonably priced.

I think my total ticket was about $10. That's affordable anywhere, but especially for the heart of San Francisco.
author: Kj L.

description: Great little spot ! Great to see a place that you could quickly stop in grab some food and then leave, no long line or having to sit down and eat ! I only got the oatmeal and a brownie but the brownie was super yummy and the people who own the spot are super nice.
author: Lauren K.

description:
Really nice food, great atmosphere, and the guy at the register was really nice! Would definitely go back.

I ordered the meathead crepe which was really creamy and filling. The salmon was moist and so was the egg.

My friend ordered the La Marsa and I tried some of it; also very filling and meaty.

The price is VERY worth it. I got my crepe at 11.50 plus my 1.75 soda, plus tax was around 14 dollars. I've had crepes that costed more and weren't as good.  This didn't disappoint.
author: Maya L.

description:
Massive disappointment. Read all the great reviews of this place and thought we'd go out of our way to grab a late lunch.

The crepes were soggy and tasted like sand and he got my order wrong. He did offer to do a new one but frankly I didn't want another Sandy Crepe. 

Over priced too for what it is. Gutted to have spent $35 on two really not good crepes and two beers!
author: Oliver B.

description: Delicious! Really good crepes! Few blocks from Union square, friendly staff, absolutely recommend!
author: Victoria G.

description: We both ordered the Le Couchon omelet, which was good. The side of breakfast potatoes was a bit warmed over and the latte I ordered was lukewarm. The $34 breakfast was over-priced for the quality...but we were so hungry that most anything would have tasted alright.
author: Scott B.

description: Although this is a small space the atmosphere is amazing. The service was impeccable and the food beyond words.
author: Britt D.

description:
A gorgeous gem a few blocks from Union Square next to Starbucks.

We were walking by after they had closed and were ogling the beautiful décor when the owner invited us in for a tour. It's a cool concept - cheerful coffee shop by day, intimate wine bar by night.

I stopped by a few days later for a morning café au lait. Service was friendly, beverage was delicious, crepes looked inviting (next time!).

I can't wait to try it out on a date as a wine bar, and am so glad they opened nearby.
author: Season H.

description: What a spectacular find! I was walking along looking for someplace to have dinner and found this exquisite, small restaurant.  The food was delicious, lovely atmosphere and unbelievably value priced. I am definitely coming back with friends. I was so excited I told our hotel concierge how wonderful this place is!
author: Brenna K.

description: This is an amazing place. We came for a wedding dinner party and they treated us incredibly well. Every dish they brought was incredibly delectable. The servers were amazing, friendly and courteous and explained all the dishes and made then appealing before i even had a bite. Will come again and recommend people to come
author: Jacob N.

description: Soooo good they spoil you and everything you your order has sooo many flavors and delicacies. Free ice cream chocolate and bailys at the end omg put me to sleep gnight.
author: Jenna W.

description: The food is ok, but the host has given us the worst customer service on our trip to San Francisco, I would go back only when that guy is not there.
author: Jorge G.

description: It's perfect for breakfast if you're in town just give it a try the sandwich with the beef and lamb sausage it's really delicious.The most delicious crep I have ever tried!
author: Mohammed K.

description: Not bad. A bit pricey and the owner is way too friendly when I just want to enjoy my lunch with my partner in peace. Had shakshouka. I've had better, but this was good. The cuisine is partly Tunisian, and the owner says that's where shakshouka originated. Not bad.
author: Daniel N.

description: Amazing cuisine, friendly service and fabulous atmosphere. The owner is charming and welcomed me upon my arrival--sat my down with a glass of rosé and some Tunisian deviled egged that were too die for. The atmosphere is cozy and warm (loved the electric guitar music). The owner had the warriors game playing and genuinely engaged with his guest about their days and his restaurant. Food is flavorful and I left feeling full and extremely happy that  popped into this place.
author: Josie P.

description: This place is nicely decorated and the food is delicious. I had the braided Moroccan chicken sandwich. It was tender and very flavorful. Will definitely recommend.
author: Kelly G.

description: Amazing breakfast! Crepes are to die for! Love love love!!! The staff is sweet and kind and efficient.
author: Michelle M.

description: A Fantastic place for dinner and wine.  Small and quaint.  The food is amazing.  The chef made me a salad not on the menu and I will say it was one of the best salads I ever had.  I kid you not.  The salad was followed by a splendid Cod with wild mushrooms and a light lemon cream.  The chef is an expert on balancing flavors and "weight". I refer to the cream sauce being light and perfectly balanced.  I highly recommend.  Lastly the prices are great for San Francisco.
author: Steven Y.

description: Absolutely delicious! Perfect for a drink and dinner pre-ACT play.  Tasty food and sweet server. Highly recommended.
author: April E.

description: An incredible hidden gem. Fantastic food, staff is friendly, knowledgeable and passionate about the food they serve. Short ribs were my favorite, followed with the devil eggs and Pinot Noir. Highly recommend for dinner, perfect date spot. Heard they also serve breakfast in the AM, will definitely be back to try it.
author: Beatrice L.

description: La marsa was a very pleasant surprise for a pre-theater Valentine's Day dinner. The setting is intimate and subtly decorated making for a cozy dining experience. The menu was simple but very intriguing Tunisian influenced offerings. The deviled eggs were exquisite and a fun way to begin dining. The sole and beef ribs were simply outstanding. Rafik has presented San Francisco with a superb culinary window into this region's ways with food. By all means give it a try!!!!
author: Rick S.

description: Had the eggs Benedict and they were inedible. No fresh squeezed OJ. Can't speak to their other dishes but what I ordered was left on the plate. Disappointing.
author: Yotam B.

description: We decided to check out La Marsa after seeing their 5-star Yelp reviews, and we were not disappointed! This is a small establishment with an inviting and cozy ambience, a super-friendly and charming proprietor (Rafik) and amazing food. Each dish was unique, expertly prepared and delicious! The deviled eggs and bruschetta were like nothing else I've ever had, and the braised short ribs with mashed potatoes melted in my mouth like butter! I would definitely like to try the other selections next time I am here. If you are looking for a unique dining experience with exceptional service, check it out. As another reviewer stated, Rafik made us feel so welcome and comfortable; this service was really unlike any other I've had in other establishments.
author: Elisa M.

description: I don't often look for a restaurant near Union Square. For the most part, it's a very touristy part of town.  However, Christmas activities brought us to this busy part of the city and while waiting for a table at a nearby restaurant with a 40-minute wait, I peeked into La Marsa and found it's intimate and warm interior to be just the right fit for us. I was thrilled to give it a try once I read the reviews and they proved to be entirely correct. Beautiful, thoughtful food served by the owner who is as gorgeous as his food (seriously!). Very attentive service without being intrusive and a limited menu that focuses on quality, rather than quantity: rich and comforting, I loved my tender short rib served over a very creamy truffle mashed potato. My friend had the lamb shank which was quite generous and we both ate every morsel while still managing to save room for dessert. La Marsa is about to turn one, and I hope more people come to discover this very special restaurant with Tunisian roots. If you are looking for a sweet restaurant that offers a superb meal prior to a show at the Curran, consider trying La Marsa. You'll be glad you did.
author: Jill S.

description: We love the food here! I highly recommend lamb for main dish., it was awesome. We can't wait to try their brunch! Thank you for all the good food!
author: Nevdil C.

description: Wonderful braised lamb shank, nice selection of international cheese, delicious harissa deviled eggs! Will like to try braised short rib next time!
author: Andrea S.

description: Loved this spot! I live nearby and have walked by this cute little cafe in the morning, transitioned to evening wine bar, many times. We went in the evening, no wait, and had the short rib with truffle mashed potatoes ($25) and it was DELICIOUS. We were so happily surprised by the food quality at this little hole in the wall. My friend also had a really yummy White Stomp wine ($12). The owner personally served us and was a really nice, funny guy. I will definitely be back! Hopefully many times.
author: Ella C.

description: Breakfast was great! Service incredible! Definitely try the crepes. 5+ stars. Very good location and within walking distance from many of the hotels.
author: Han Y.

description: Really great place in the heart of the theater district. We stopped for breakfast and it was amazing. The smoked salmon crepe with the chive creme fraiche is divine. For a sweet treat the salted caramel is delicious. Friendly staff. Great stop
author: Kristen K.

description: All other places had long lines. So glad we skipped those and came here. My salmon, cream cheese, bacon omlete was so good. So was Marizel's 2 eggs over ratatouille.  I would take pictures of the cleaned off plates. Hope to come back later for my butter and sugar crepe.
author: Sherwin B.

description: Dinner was inventive and delicious.  Service was attentive and knowledgeable.  Really nice wines. Yes, the place is cozy, but not cramped.  I highly recommend this for pre- or post-theater.
author: Will F.

description: really good cafe. small but cute. lumberjack crepe was really good and the croisant breakfast sandwich with the lamb and beef sausage was so tasty and addictive, it is my new favorite breakfast dish. staff was busy but nice and cleaned the tables promptly.
author: B F.

description: The Tunisian deviled  eggs three halves tastira mousse and roasted shrimp you can eat your fingers after this dish for how good it was . Must try . Thx chef rafik .
author: Chikh Tarek A.

description: Terrific new addition. In a neighborhood full of tourist traps, this real restaurant is a welcome exception.
author: Alex A.

description: A very wonderful place , charming people and a good welcome .. we got omelette "le saumon " and Nutella crêpe and it s  very delicious 3 love this place
author: Omar F.

description: Carefully made food just for me. You can feel the treat! I had the lamb, the meat was perfect jus like the flavours. Sides can be improved later on!
author: Dani S.

description:
Such a wonderful and unexpected dinner experience! Great ambiance with beautiful decor and nice oriental music. 
The owner Rafik is so nice and welcoming! He does everything himself, it's impressive. Menu options are limited but everything looks appealing. 
We started with the deviled eggs which are a must try! So tasty and surprising. 
For the entree, I had the short ribs with truffle mashed potatoes and red wine and beer reduction... Yep, it's as amazing as it sounds. Full of flavor, the meat is perfectly cooked. 
I also tried my mother's lamb riblets; melts in the mouth and the pesto is delicious, as well as my husband's mergez plate; so good and fresh-tasting. And also, all dishes are beautifully presented! 
The wine list is great and the owner is here to give you some advice on what to pair with your food. 
The only downside is quantity, some of the entrees are missing a little side... but after the delicious dessert (vanilla ice cream, crushed almonds and you pour an expresso on top), we were all nicely full! 
We will definitely be back in this little gem. 
During the day it's apparently a completely different experience with a different menu (coffee, croissant, crepes). Can't wait to try this as well!
author: Laura G.

description: Awesome little crepe place, with solid Illy espresso! Buckwheat crepes are gluten free btw, savory, with ratatouille, or smoked salmon and soft-cooked egg, etc. Also sandwiches and sweet crepes. Reminds me of a simple sidestreet creperie in Paris.
author: killu s.

description: Exceptional service and the food was delicious.  Try the Short ribs over mashed potatoes.
author: Phil Q.

description:
Moroccan Chicken sandwich was great. They use high quality ingredients including bread from the Acme Bakery in the Ferry Building. The chicken is really well done and the sandwich is healthy but satisfying. Pro tip : ask for some harissa sauce on the side.

Rafik, the owner, is very nice and welcoming.  He went out of his way to spend time educating me on the background of the sandwich and the cuisine he grew up with.

Highly recommend for dine in or take out.
author: Ted B.

description: A solid 3.5 the food was delicious! The owner (?) was a little pushy and not super friendly. The chef was more friendly and accommodating.
author: Shortty 1.

description: This is a great alternative to the starf***s next door.  Great coffee drinks (illy), tasty crepes, and assorted other yummies.  The owner is super friendly.  And it's a wine bar at night.  Perfect spot before or after a show at the Curran or Geary theaters.
author: Linda G.

description: Visiting SF on a business trip and stopped by LA Marsa.  The Moroccan chicken sandwich was awesome!!  Would definately eat here again.
author: Mark H.

description: Great food and excellent service. I've never had Tunisian, but I will certainly try it again.
author: Tydie H.

description: Great, friendly spot with excellent coffee right across from the theatre. They serve illy coffee and espresso drinks, breakfast and have a wine bar at night. The interior is beautifully and creatively decorated with handmade wooden sconces on the walls. Unique and lovely.
author: Carmela D.

description: I just moved into the neighborhood and stumbled upon this gem during my first dinner out. The owner was friendly and enthusiastic about his food and space. We came in late (right before closing) and expected to rush through dinner, but the owner waited on us and made the experience special! The vibe in the space is relaxed and the food is delicious. We had the lamb, chicken, and the deviled egg appetizer. Everything hit the spot. So excited to come back here again!
author: Jessica L.

description: Good ambience. We had a lovely conversation with the owner/cook/waiter. He's smart and cute. Will come back again for sure.
author: Zheng W.

description: Relatively cheap for SF but the marsa crepe was average. Omelette soft but small portions.
author: Alison D.

description: Pricey but delicious and hot!  I ordered the eggplant with eggs dish and OMG it's out of this world!  My boyfriend had the bagel sandwich with the lamb/beef sausage and it was wonderful.  I just had to order the sugar and butter crepes...another hit.  THE BEST was the capucchino!  Hot and delicious.  Go eat here!
author: Marissa G.

description: We had a wonderful experience having dinner here. It's brand new, and the decor is beautiful and polished. The atmosphere warm and inviting and I loved all the natural wood accents. Everything on the menu looked delicious and interesting, which I always appreciate. My husband enjoyed his braised short ribs and my half chicken was perfectly cooked and flavorful. The owner was very friendly and made us feel welcomed, while simultaneously cooking and serving the food! I always love restaurants that provide an experience in addition to good food, and we found that here. I hope to be back next time we are in the city!
author: Alyssa S.

description: What a treat. The owner and chef was both friendly and very talented. Food was amazing, familiar dishes with a Tunisian flair. He put his own special touch on everything, including the triple bruschetta starter--definitely try this. Service was impeccable. I feel really lucky to have eaten in this charming little place.
author: Melissa S.

description: Great place to eat if you want some unique yet super delicious food. We came on Valentine's evening and managed to get a table. Rafik is really friendly and warm. We had the devil's eggs, cumin snapper and sausages. They were all excellent!!! But the cumin snapper is Amaziiiingg!!!  Definitely worth the wait! Highly recommended!!!
author: Mooi L.

description: Amazing!! Just stumbled on this little gem. I had an incredible dinner here. Red Snapper was out of this world. And loved the service. The two men running this restaurant are adept and passionate. Had a great time. I'll be back. Wish they were in Portland! They'd be on the regular rotation.
author: Cindy M.

description: Fantastic place for breakfast. Next time will have lunch. The food is very tasty and refined. The staff is very friendly. You feel at home..... with a sophisticated chef that is. L8VE YOU LA MARSA
author: Anya M.

description: Just happened upon this place looking for a good meal. The Chef himself invited us in and said we would not be disappointed he was right. The meat was so tender, no knife needed. Try the deviled egg app. "Amazing". I haven't tried Tunisian food before, but have a new appreciation for the flavor. Great experience.
author: Guillermo O.

description: Awesome experience.  Great food and very entertaining host.  I highly recommend.   Had the snapper and the short ribs...absolutely great.
author: C A.

description: Hey! Breakfast was just expensive - nothing special at all! The lunch looked good though.
author: Katharina T.

description: Wonderful, attentive and gracious host who is very aware of how to treat his patrons. Quite and relaxing atmosphere, a good wine list and an adaptable menu. A much needed addition to this area.
author: Marc Olivier F.

description: The food was OUTSTANDING .,The owner made, servered, and entertained use with great stories...HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
author: John C.

description: Great food and even better service. The owner, Rafik,made us feel as though we were guests in his home. We had the merguez, lamb chops, and deviled eggs. Each dish was really unique and flavorful. The salad with the merguez is spicy, but not overwhelmingly spicy. The deviled eggs were made with avocado and delicious. I almost never leave yelp reviews, but the service was really unlike anything else I have experienced when visiting San Francisco.
author: Anonymous H.

description: We have been to La Marsa twice now, and it's going to be our spot from now on when we find ourselves downtown. The owner is AMAZING, going out of his way to make sure customers are well taken care of, while not taking any guff from anyone giving him a hard time. Great wines, cheese, crepes, and atmosphere. Also, an incredible electropop cover of California Dreamin' on the speakers. This place is everything we want to support in our fine city.
author: Richie Z.

description: I love this new coffee and wine bar in downtown SF.  They serve my fav coffee, Illy,  and the best part is that the Barista really knows how to make superb espresso drinks.  The food is awesome; fresh, tasty and reasonably priced. My favorite is the bruschetta trio. I also like their selection of wine and the great prices.  The place is small and intimate, inviting with beautiful decor.  Great to go solo, with a friend or on a date.  Service is excellent and friendly.  Hard to find this great combo in the neighborhood nowadays.
author: Yvonne C.

description: I have no words - the food and atmosphere is spot on!!!!!    Ask for Rafik - he held a private event for my job and it truly exceeded expectations!   What are you doing reading this - GO to La Marsa!
author: J J.

description: Super good crepes! They taste like in France which is what I was looking for. Very cute environment. The manager is super nice and welcoming. Sweet crepes are delicious as well. This is my new favorite spot as I work accross the street.
author: Anne P.

description: It's a gem! A culinary treat by a delightful chef-extraordinaire himself waiting just a few tables in a low-key setting. Wish we had more dining places like this. Rafik, you are a real visionary!
author: Ether S.

description: Great customer service! The Meathead crepe was delicious!! They also make a great iced almond vanilla latte!  Will definitely be back
author: Tauni D.

description: Loved the place amazing ambiance especially at night . really good and fresh food.  A must try
author: A S.

description: We went here for breakfast. There was only one person running the entire place. He was working so hard and was wonderful but the owner needs to hire another person. It is unreasonable to expect one person to handle everything.
author: Kelly S.
